places365_project.pipelines.dataset_creation package¶

Submodules¶

places365_project.pipelines.dataset_creation.nodes module¶

places365_project.pipelines.dataset_creation.nodes.prune(data_dir, prune_frac)[source]¶

Deletes set percentage of samples from each class

Parameters

  • data_dir (str) – Path to the root of processed dataset

  • prune_frac (float) – Percentage of samples to stay in dataset

places365_project.pipelines.dataset_creation.nodes.refactor_data_structure(raw_dir, new_dir, delete_old)[source]¶

Refactors directory structure to match standard structure for image dataset. End result will look like this:

root |- class1

|- image1 |- image2 …

|- class2 …

Parameters

  • raw_dir (str) – Path to the root of original dataset

  • new_dir (str) – Path to the root of processed dataset. Entire dataset will be refactored to this path.

  • delete_old (bool) – If true old dataset will be deleted from memory. Use true if memory is limited

places365_project.pipelines.dataset_creation.nodes.split_into_train_val_test(data_dir, new_dir, split, delete_old)[source]¶

Refactors data directory structure into train/val/test directories. End result will look like this: root |- train

|- class1

|- image1 |- image2 …

|- class2 …

|- val
|- class1

|- image1 |- image2 …

|- class2 …

|- test

…

Parameters

  • data_dir (str) – Path to the refactored dataset

  • new_dir (str) – New path to the splitted dataset

  • split (tuple) – three elements representing train-validation-test ratio. e.g. (6,2,2) would correspond to 60% of data used for training and 20% for both validation and testing

  • delete_old (bool) – If true old dataset will be deleted from memory. Use true if memory is limited
